CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 09.01.2019, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Crl.MC.No. 114 of 2019 2 2019/KER/1009 ORDER Petition filed under Section 482 Cr.P.C. 2. Petitioners are the accused in C.C.No.127/2013 on the file of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class-II, Nedumangad. They are alleged to have committed the offences under Sections 294(b) and 427 IPC. Second respondent is the victim. It is submitted that the matter has been settled and the proceedings in the trial court may be quashed. 3. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioners and second respondent and_ the learned Public Prosecutor. 4. I have perused the affidavit filed by the second respondent, who has entered appearance through counsel. T am satisfied that the matter has been settled and no _ public interest is involved in this case. There is no impediment for granting the prayer of the petitioners. x porta Bea Cr1.MC.No. 114 of 2019 3 2019/KER/1009 In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed. The proceedings in C.C.No.127/2013 on the file of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class-II, Nedumangad are quashed. If any material objects have been produced in this case, the trial court may pass appropriate orders for their disposal. Sd/- K.
